</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#jobdefinitionekspropertiespodpropertiesvolume">Sequence[Job<wbr>Definition<wbr>Eks<wbr>Properties<wbr>Pod<wbr>Properties<wbr>Volume]</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Volumes for a job definition that uses Amazon EKS resources. AWS Batch supports emptyDir, hostPath, and secret volume types.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

            title="Required">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>DNS policy for the pod. The default value is <code>ClusterFirst</code>. If the <code>host_network</code> argument is not specified, the default is <code>ClusterFirstWithHostNet</code>. <code>ClusterFirst</code> indicates that any DNS query that does not match the configured cluster domain suffix is forwarded to the upstream nameserver inherited from the node. For more information, see Pod's DNS policy in the Kubernetes documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostnetwork_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostnetwork_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Network</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether the pod uses the hosts' network IP address. The default value is <code>true</code>. Setting this to <code>false</code> enables the Kubernetes pod networking model. Most AWS Batch workloads are egress-only and don't require the overhead of IP allocation for each pod for incoming connections.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="imagepullsecrets_yaml">

            title="Required">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Docker image used to start the container.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="args_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#args_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Args</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Array of arguments to the entrypoint. If this isn't specified, the CMD of the container image is used. This corresponds to the args member in the Entrypoint portion of the Pod in Kubernetes. Environment variable references are expanded using the container's environment.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="commands_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#commands_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Commands</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Entrypoint for the container. This isn't run within a shell. If this isn't specified, the ENTRYPOINT of the container image is used. Environment variable references are expanded using the container's environment.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="envs_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#envs_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Envs</a>
</span>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Name of the container. If the name isn't specified, the default name &quot;Default&quot; is used. Each container in a pod must have a unique name.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="resources_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#resources_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Resources</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#jobdefinitionekspropertiespodpropertiescontainersresources">Job<wbr>Definition<wbr>Eks<wbr>Properties<wbr>Pod<wbr>Properties<wbr>Containers<wbr>Resources</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Type and amount of resources to assign to a container. The supported resources include <code>memory</code>, <code>cpu</code>, and <code>nvidia.com/gpu</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="securitycontext_csharp">

<h4 id="jobdefinitiontimeout">
Job<wbr>Definition<wbr>Timeout<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python,go" class="inline">, Job<wbr>Definition<wbr>Timeout<wbr>Args</pulumi-choosable>
</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="attemptdurationseconds_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#attemptdurationseconds_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Attempt<wbr>Duration<wbr>Seconds</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Time duration in seconds after which AWS Batch terminates your jobs if they have not finished. The minimum value for the timeout is <code>60</code> seconds.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Time duration in seconds after which AWS Batch terminates your jobs if they have not finished. The minimum value for the timeout is <code>60</code> seconds.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Batch Job Definition using the `arn`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:batch/jobDefinition:JobDefinition test arn:aws:batch:us-east-1:123456789012:job-definition/sample
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
